Text: So, how exactly does one utilize the functionality of this audio plugin?

@ zogulusnig

there are tutorials on y*u t**e
I got it.  Pro Tools and the like.  Thanks for the up.
audacity should work with au plugins. its the only free open source software for audio editing. you need the 3.1 beta though.

Cool.  Thanks.  I didn't even think about Audacity.  It works great, as I just confirmed.

However, the installation instructions for the Plug In (at least for Audacity) is not quite correct.

It says to install into /Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/Components...

It should be /Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/VST

Then it's working great in Audacity.  Thanks again.

ok to the above ^

apple software will only detect au plugins in the component folder. i believe that's the same for soundbooth, pro tools, etc. audacity will only detect it in the vst because the vst plugin and the au plugin support is the same extension on audacity.

Agreed.  After some research, I absolutely concur.

This is an Audacity-ONLY fix.
how come the file is so tinny ?and can anyone confirm that this works on protools LE? for mac?

its a condensed version with only the .au component file. it doesnt have any documentations or installers for multiple plugin formats like vst, etc. someone on msj tried on pro tools full version, so it should work for le if it supports that feature.
When I unzip I get a lot of folders and subfolders with different stuff. Shal I put it all in in my Logic component folder or is it a specific file I sould put in there?
this is for mac if you haven't noticed at all. when you unzip, it should give you a file named "Auto-Tune_Evo_AU.component" which you then move to the folder.
Looks awesome.  Can't wait to try it out.  Thanks a million!
Works great!

Guys,

It's not gonna work for Pro Tools because it's not an RTAS plugin. This will only work in programs that utilize AU plugins. 

If anyone can find an RTAS version of this for Mac please let me know!!!!
